Patients experienced significantly more changes to their medications as a result of pharmacist-led interventions (mean difference=0.94 medications [CI, 0.57-1.31]). There is no specific treatment for dengue fever. Treatment is focused on relieving the symptoms and supporting the body through the disease. In severe cases, hospitalization may be necessary to provide supportive care.
Can dengue fever be prevented?
There is no vaccine for dengue fever, but the disease can be prevented by avoiding mosquito bites. Mosquitoes that carry the virus that causes dengue fever are more active during the day, so it is important to use mosquito repellent and wear long sleeves and pants during the day.
